body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of South Carolina:
examples: Congaree National Park contains over 20,000 acres of federally designated wilderness that visitors can explore by either foot, kayak, or canoe.
Astonishing biodiversity exists in Congaree National Park, the largest intact expanse of old-growth bottomland hardwood forest remaining in the southeastern United States.
